change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The main person reporting is Father Francisco Antonio Barbastro, from Aconchi, Father President of the Northern missions from 1781 to 1783. Photocopies of typed transcriptions of 20 letters and reports from Franciscans regarding Sinaloan and Sonoran missions. Addressees include Commissioner General Ugarte y Loyola, Bishop Granados, Viceroy Conde de Gálvez, and Viceroy Manuel Antonio Flores.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Franciscan reports (MS 216). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The main person reporting is Father Francisco Antonio Barbastro, from Aconchi, Father President of the Northern missions from 1781 to 1783. Other writers include Commissioner General Jacobo Ugarte y Loyola, Bishop José Joaquín Granados at Arizpe, and Guardian Superior Father Juan José Saenz de Gumiel at the Querétaro College.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of typed transciptions of 20 letters and reports from Franciscans regarding Sinaloan and Sonoran missions. Addressees include Commissioner General Ugarte y Loyola, Bishop Granados, Viceroy Conde de Gálvez, and Viceroy Manuel Antonio Flores.

relatedmaterial.p: In part, photocopies from the Archivo General de la Nación, Mexico City, and the Bancroft Library, Berkeley.
